intro: Neoruschia cogniauxiana, commonly known as the African violet, is a flowering plant native to eastern and southern Africa. It belongs to the Gesneriaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, thick leaves and showy, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows as a perennial herb, often forming dense clumps with a low-growing habit. Its flowers come in a variety of colors, including purple, blue, and white, and are pollinated primarily by bees and other insects. Neoruschia cogniauxiana is popular as a houseplant due to its ornamental value and relatively easy care requirements.
